intro: Pasania elizabethae, commonly known as the Elizabeth's pasania, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has elliptical leaves with a smooth texture and a pale green color. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a cool, humid environment. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
